 The video industry is lucky in this way actually. When music is ripped from a CD it is possible to get it in perfect CD quality with a fairly low file size. Ripping a movie off a DVD results in a substancially lower quality video, the sound is worse, and burning it to CD will not allow you to play it in a DVD player. So even if the video industry allowed people to download movies I think buying them on DVD would be common.
 
 I don't think the video industry is taking a risk at this point. You can anyone with a DVD player on their computer can make it possible for people to make illegal copies of movies and the P2P sharing programs allow the entire world to access these movies. Not everyone does this today and not everyone would do this if the movie industry did start selling them online. I don't know if it would make the problem worse or not. For my opinion though, I would much prefer to pay for these movies at a reasonable cost over a legal site but the movie industry just hasn't made that possible yet.
